The 'Shanghai Metro' is the rapid transit system serving the city of Shanghai, a
direct-controlled municipality in the People's Republic of China. The system
incorporates both subway and light metro lines. The first line opened in 1993,
making Shanghai the third city in Mainland China, after Beijing and Tianjin, to
have a rapid transit system. Since then, the Shanghai Metro has become one of
the fastest-growing rapid transit systems in the world, with several lines still
under construction.

Overall, there are 12 metro lines
and 289 stations The stations on the Maglev line and Line 22 are not
counted in both cases.|name=Stncount|group=note}}, with an operating route
length of , making the system the third longest in the
world. The Shanghai Metro delivered 2.276 billion rides in 2012, making it the fifth busiest metro system in the world. It set
a daily ridership record of 8.486 million on March 9, 2013.
